items.text: I often go out of my way to help others, even if it inconveniences me.
items.rationale: Helping others at a personal cost is a key aspect of Agreeableness.

items.text: I find it easy to forgive others when they apologize.
items.rationale: Forgiveness is a central component of Agreeableness.

items.text: I am patient with people who take a long time to get to the point.
items.rationale: Patience with others is indicative of high Agreeableness.

items.text: I rarely hold grudges against people.
items.rationale: Not holding grudges is a sign of Agreeableness.

items.text: I enjoy making people feel comfortable and at ease.
items.rationale: Creating comfort for others is a trait of Agreeableness.

items.text: I often put others' needs before my own.
items.rationale: Prioritizing others' needs is a hallmark of Agreeableness.

items.text: I try to see things from other people's perspectives.
items.rationale: Empathy and perspective-taking are key to Agreeableness.

items.text: I am quick to offer a helping hand to those in need.
items.rationale: Helping others readily is a characteristic of Agreeableness.

items.text: I often compliment others to make them feel good.
items.rationale: Giving compliments is a behavior associated with Agreeableness.

items.text: I avoid arguments and try to keep the peace.
items.rationale: Avoiding conflict is a trait of Agreeableness.

items.text: I am sensitive to the feelings of others.
items.rationale: Sensitivity to others' feelings is a core aspect of Agreeableness.

items.text: I often find myself mediating disputes between friends.
items.rationale: Mediating disputes is a behavior linked to Agreeableness.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to say no to people.
items.rationale: Difficulty saying no can indicate Agreeableness but may also relate to low assertiveness.

items.text: I prefer to avoid confrontations, even if it means not standing up for myself.
items.rationale: Avoiding confrontation is Agreeable, but not standing up for oneself can relate to low self-esteem.

items.text: I often find myself agreeing with others to avoid conflict, even if I don't fully agree.
items.rationale: Could map to Agreeableness (conflict avoidance) or low Honesty-Humility (insincerity).

items.text: I like to keep my workspace organized and tidy.
items.rationale: Organization and tidiness are key aspects of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I always make sure to finish tasks before the deadline.
items.rationale: Meeting deadlines is a hallmark of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I plan my day carefully to ensure I accomplish my goals.
items.rationale: Planning and goal-setting are central to Conscientiousness.

items.text: I am detail-oriented and notice small errors.
items.rationale: Attention to detail is a trait of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I prefer to have a clear schedule rather than be spontaneous.
items.rationale: Preference for schedules over spontaneity is indicative of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I am reliable and people can count on me to do what I say.
items.rationale: Reliability is a core component of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I set high standards for myself and strive to meet them.
items.rationale: Setting and meeting high standards is a trait of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I am disciplined and can resist temptations easily.
items.rationale: Discipline and self-control are key aspects of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I like to have a plan for everything I do.
items.rationale: Having a plan is indicative of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I am thorough in my work and rarely make mistakes.
items.rationale: Thoroughness and accuracy are traits of Conscientiousness.

items.text: I often review my work to ensure it's done correctly.
items.rationale: Reviewing work for accuracy is a behavior associated with Conscientiousness.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to relax if I have unfinished tasks.
items.rationale: Difficulty relaxing with unfinished tasks can indicate Conscientiousness but may also relate to anxiety.

items.text: I prefer to work on one task at a time rather than multitask.
items.rationale: Preference for single-tasking can indicate Conscientiousness but may also relate to focus issues.

items.text: I often feel stressed when I have too many responsibilities.
items.rationale: Could map to Conscientiousness (responsibility) or Emotionality (stress response).

items.text: I often worry about things that might go wrong.
items.rationale: Worrying about potential problems is a key aspect of Emotionality.

items.text: I feel emotions very deeply and intensely.
items.rationale: Experiencing intense emotions is a hallmark of Emotionality.

items.text: I am easily moved to tears by sad movies or stories.
items.rationale: Being easily moved to tears indicates high Emotionality.

items.text: I often feel anxious in new situations.
items.rationale: Anxiety in new situations is a trait of Emotionality.

items.text: I am sensitive to criticism and take it to heart.
items.rationale: Sensitivity to criticism is indicative of Emotionality.

items.text: I often feel overwhelmed by my emotions.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed by emotions is a core aspect of Emotionality.

items.text: I am easily affected by the moods of those around me.
items.rationale: Being affected by others' moods is a trait of Emotionality.

items.text: I often feel nervous when I have to speak in front of a group.
items.rationale: Nervousness in public speaking is associated with Emotionality.

items.text: I am prone to feeling lonely even when I'm with others.
items.rationale: Feeling lonely in company is a sign of Emotionality.

items.text: I often feel a strong need for emotional support from others.
items.rationale: Needing emotional support is a characteristic of Emotionality.

items.text: I am quick to feel sympathy for others' misfortunes.
items.rationale: Feeling sympathy quickly is a trait of Emotionality.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to control my emotions.
items.rationale: Difficulty controlling emotions can indicate Emotionality but may also relate to impulsivity.

items.text: I often feel a strong connection to nature and the environment.
items.rationale: Feeling connected to nature can indicate Emotionality but may also relate to Openness.

items.text: I often feel drained after social interactions.
items.rationale: Could map to Emotionality (emotional drain) or low Extraversion (social fatigue).

items.text: I enjoy being the center of attention at social gatherings.
items.rationale: Enjoying attention is a key aspect of Extraversion.

items.text: I feel energized after spending time with others.
items.rationale: Feeling energized by social interaction is a hallmark of Extraversion.

items.text: I am outgoing and make friends easily.
items.rationale: Being outgoing and sociable is indicative of Extraversion.

items.text: I enjoy meeting new people and learning about their lives.
items.rationale: Interest in meeting new people is a trait of Extraversion.

items.text: I am talkative and enjoy engaging in conversations.
items.rationale: Being talkative is a core component of Extraversion.

items.text: I often seek out social events and gatherings.
items.rationale: Seeking social events is a behavior associated with Extraversion.

items.text: I am enthusiastic and full of energy.
items.rationale: Enthusiasm and energy are traits of Extraversion.

items.text: I enjoy being in large groups of people.
items.rationale: Enjoying large groups is indicative of Extraversion.

items.text: I am assertive and confident in social situations.
items.rationale: Assertiveness in social settings is a trait of Extraversion.

items.text: I often take the lead in group activities.
items.rationale: Taking the lead is a behavior linked to Extraversion.

items.text: I am comfortable speaking in front of large audiences.
items.rationale: Comfort with public speaking is a sign of Extraversion.

items.text: I sometimes feel restless when I'm alone for too long.
items.rationale: Restlessness when alone can indicate Extraversion but may also relate to boredom.

items.text: I prefer to be in the company of others rather than by myself.
items.rationale: Preference for company can indicate Extraversion but may also relate to dependency.

items.text: I often find myself talking more than listening in conversations.
items.rationale: Could map to Extraversion (talkativeness) or low Agreeableness (dominance in conversation).

items.text: I believe in being fair and honest, even if it costs me.
items.rationale: Valuing fairness and honesty is a key aspect of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I avoid manipulating others to get what I want.
items.rationale: Avoiding manipulation is a hallmark of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I am humble and do not boast about my achievements.
items.rationale: Humility and lack of boastfulness are indicative of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I am willing to admit when I am wrong.
items.rationale: Admitting mistakes is a trait of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I do not take advantage of others, even if I could benefit.
items.rationale: Not exploiting others is a core component of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I value sincerity and authenticity in myself and others.
items.rationale: Valuing sincerity is a behavior associated with Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I am not interested in gaining power over others.
items.rationale: Lack of interest in power is a trait of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I prefer to share credit with others rather than take it all myself.
items.rationale: Sharing credit is indicative of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I am honest, even when it is difficult.
items.rationale: Honesty in difficult situations is a sign of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I do not feel superior to others.
items.rationale: Lack of superiority is a characteristic of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I am modest about my accomplishments.
items.rationale: Modesty is a trait of Honesty-Humility.

items.text: I often put others' interests before my own.
items.rationale: Putting others first can indicate Honesty-Humility but may also relate to Agreeableness.

items.text: I prefer to be straightforward rather than use flattery.
items.rationale: Preference for straightforwardness can indicate Honesty-Humility but may also relate to low Agreeableness.

items.text: I often feel guilty if I don't tell the whole truth.
items.rationale: Could map to Honesty-Humility (truthfulness) or Emotionality (guilt).

items.text: I enjoy exploring new ideas and concepts.
items.rationale: Exploring new ideas is a key aspect of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I am curious about the world and enjoy learning new things.
items.rationale: Curiosity and love of learning are hallmarks of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I appreciate art and beauty in all its forms.
items.rationale: Appreciation of art and beauty is indicative of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I enjoy trying new foods and cuisines.
items.rationale: Trying new foods is a trait of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I am open to new experiences and adventures.
items.rationale: Being open to new experiences is a core component of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I enjoy thinking about philosophical and abstract concepts.
items.rationale: Interest in abstract concepts is a behavior associated with Openness to Experience.

items.text: I am imaginative and enjoy daydreaming.
items.rationale: Imagination and daydreaming are traits of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I am receptive to new and unconventional ideas.
items.rationale: Receptivity to new ideas is indicative of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I enjoy visiting new places and exploring different cultures.
items.rationale: Exploring cultures is a sign of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I am open-minded and willing to consider different viewpoints.
items.rationale: Open-mindedness is a characteristic of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I enjoy creative activities such as painting or writing.
items.rationale: Engagement in creative activities is a trait of Openness to Experience.

items.text: I sometimes find myself lost in thought about abstract ideas.
items.rationale: Abstract thinking is a trait of Openness but may also relate to introspection.

items.text: I enjoy listening to a wide variety of music genres.
items.rationale: Enjoying diverse music can indicate Openness but may also relate to cultural exposure.

items.text: I like to keep my options open rather than commit to a plan.
items.rationale: Could map to Openness (flexibility) or low Conscientiousness (lack of planning).
